H0.text: Which Scottish engineer gave the first public demonstration of TV. James Watt

H1.text: Which Scottish engineer gave the first public demonstration of TV. William Thomson (Lord Kelvin)

H2.text: Which Scottish engineer gave the first public demonstration of TV. James Clerk Maxwell

H3.text: Which Scottish engineer gave the first public demonstration of TV. Logie Baird

A4.text: John Logie Baird gave the first public demonstration of television at Selfridges department store in London in a three-week period beginning on 25 March 1925.

A5.text: On 26 January 1926, Baird gave the first public demonstration of true television images for members of the Royal Institution and a reporter from The Times in his laboratory at 22 Frith Street in the Soho district of London.
